A 42-year-old [woman] reports neck stiffness, upper extremity pain, clumsiness, weakness, and instability of gait. Examination reveals 4+ of 5 strength in the upper extremities and 3+ biceps, brachioradialis, and patellar reflexes with a positive Hoffman sign bilaterally. Correct answer: Ossification of the posterior longitudinal ligament
